medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric discomfort following consumption of eggs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to presentation with epigastric discomfort after eating eggs. He felt cold, experienced a fever of 101Â°F, and reported decreased oral intake. No diarrhea, abdominal pain, or vomiting were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Multiple myeloma post-autologous transplant, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, degenerative joint disease, osteoporosis, obstructive sleep apnea requiring CPAP, episodic vertigo, ocular migraines, history of bilateral knee arthroscopies, and hernia repair as a child.
medical_history.family_history: Both grandfathers had gastrointestinal cancers (type unknown). The mother had lupus and died from a complication of it; the father died from coronary artery disease at an unspecified age.
